x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Nonprofits and community-led events often struggle to maintain consistent engagement with sponsors and volunteers. Tracking contributions, follow-ups, and impact stories is manual, scattered across emails and spreadsheets. This leads to missed renewals, low retention, and underreported impact—especially for recurring events or campaigns.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A ServiceNow-powered app where:

  • Organizers can log sponsor and volunteer interactions, contributions, and commitments
  • Automated nudges remind teams about renewals, thank-you notes, and impact updates
  • QR codes link to personalized sponsor pages or volunteer certificates
  • Dashboards show cumulative impact: hours volunteered, funds raised, lives touched
  • Sponsors can view their brand visibility, event reach, and social media impressions

  • App Engine Studio for custom record types (Sponsor, Volunteer, Event)
  • Flow Designer for automated follow-ups and reminders
  • Document Management for certificates, thank-you letters, and impact reports
  • UI Builder for clean, sponsor-friendly dashboards
  • Scoped App with ACLs for privacy and role-based access
  • IntegrationHub for syncing with Mailchimp, LinkedIn, or Canva for branded assets

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Optional: Mailchimp or Outlook integration for automated emails
  • QR code generation and Base64 encoding for certificates and sponsor pages
  • Google Sheets or Airtable sync for legacy data import

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Standardizing sponsor and volunteer data formats across events
  • Ensuring timely updates and engagement from organizers
  • Balancing automation with personalized outreach
  • Training small teams to use dashboards and workflows effectivel
